1.name: Quick Reload
1.description: 30% (60%) chance to activate every 20s: increases this ship's RLD by 20% (40%) for 10s.

2.name: All Out Assault Ⅰ
2.description: Activate All Out Assault Ⅰ: Omaha Class once every 12 times the main gun is fired.

1.name: Memphis
1.description: Omaha-class light cruiser – Memphis, Hull Number CL-12.

2.name: カジュアルバケーション
2.description: あら、この格好はそんなに珍しいかしら？私だって非番の日はあるのよ？ふふん、こうしてのんびりと海風を浴びるのも気持ちいいと思わない？

3.name: Mystical Night
3.description: We have to work hard if we want to play hard, isn't that right, Commander? Are you ready for our happy Halloween?

limitBreak.tier1: Unlock All Out Assault Ⅰ/All weapons' efficiency +2%
limitBreak.tier3: Improve All Out Assault/All weapons' efficiency +5%

1.chinese: 奥马哈级轻巡洋舰—孟菲斯，舷号CL-13
1.chineseTL: Omaha-class light cruiser - Memphis, Hull No. CL-13
1.japanese: オマハ級軽巡洋艦・メンフィス（CL-12)
1.english: Omaha-class light cruiser – Memphis, Hull Number CL-12.

2.chinese: 我是奥马哈级的轻巡洋舰孟菲斯。生涯里迎接过一些重要的宾客，也曾作为旗舰被征用。多说无用，想要更好地了解我，就好好跟在后头，看我的精彩表现吧~
2.chineseTL: I am Omaha-class light cruiser Memphis. During my career, I hosted some important guests and also used as a flagship. Words aren't needed, if you want to know me better, just follow me and watch my spectacular performance.
2.japanese: オマハ級軽巡のメンフィスよ。由緒正しい方々の乗艦、そしてロイヤル方面艦隊の旗艦を勤めたの。…後ろで私の活躍を目に焼き付けなさいな
2.japaneseTL: Omaha-class light cruiser Memphis. During my carrer I served as shipboard for esteemed historical individuals as well as a flagship of the Royal Navy... Just follow me and etch my performance into your eyes
2.english: I am the Omaha-class light cruiser, Memphis. I've hosted some very famous people, as well as served as flagship of the fleet in the Royal front. Make sure you carefully observe my every move!

3.chinese: 哦？你就是这里的指挥官吗？放心吧，我会为你护航的。不过，你得要先达到我的标准才行呢~
3.chineseTL: Ah? So you're the Commander here? Don't worry, I'll be serving as your vanguard. But, you must first meet my standards~
3.japanese: ふーん、あなたがここの指揮官？安心なさい。この私が護衛についてあげる。貴方はこの私に相応しくなれるのかしら？
3.japaneseTL: Hmm~ So you're the Commander here? Don't worry, I'll server as your vanguard. I wonder if you're able to meet my standards?
3.english: Hmm, so you're the commander here? Don't worry, I'll carry out my duties as an escort ship. But first, you'll have to meet my standards!

4.chinese: 指挥官，总算来了。那就出发吧~快跟上我的脚步！
4.chineseTL: Commander, you finally came. Let's depart~ Follow me!
4.japanese: 指揮官、ようやく来たのね。さあ出発よ——私のペースについてこれるのかしら？
4.japaneseTL: Commander, you finally came. Let's depart~ Will you be able to keep up with me?
4.english: Commander, you sure took your time getting here. Come on, let's set sail. Can you keep up with me?

5.chinese: 如果想继续陪着我，那就好好审视我的全部吧~
5.chineseTL: If you want to keep me in company, then take a good look at every part on me~
5.japanese: 私と付き合ってくれるつもりなら、すべてを目に焼き付けてちょうだい
5.japaneseTL: If you want to keep me in company, then etch every part of me into your eyes
5.english: If you intend to keep me by your side, you'd better carefully observe my every move!

6.chinese: 接受检阅，就应该把最好的一面展示给大家看。这是我的准则~
6.chineseTL: In a performance review, you should show off your best side to everyone. That's my norm~
6.japanese: 観艦式で自らの最も素晴らしいパフォーマンスを魅せる。これこそ私の流儀よ
6.japaneseTL: In a naval review, charm everyone with your most spectacular performance. That is my style
6.english: Capturing everyone's attention with my brilliant performance at Naval Reviews - that's the way I like to do things.

7.chinese: 一直以来都频繁地巡洋四海，在港区多待上一段时间都是奢望…不过没关系，我喜欢让自己忙碌起来~
7.chineseTL: All this time I have been busy roaming the seas, being able to spend more time in the port has become a luxury... But it's fine, I enjoy being busy myself~
7.japanese: 昔は海を行き来して、母港でのんびりすることも中々できなかったの。…まあいいわ。忙しいほうが私らしくて良いのではなくて？
7.japaneseTL: Since the past I have been roaming around the seas, never being able to relax in port... Well it's whatever. Don't you think it's better to keep someone like me busy all the time?
7.english: Because of my hectic schedule, I never got much time to relax back in port... But that's fine, someone like me ought to be busy, wouldn't you agree~?

8.chinese: 要我在回港的时候带点礼物给你？指挥官得先在港区好好表现才行~
8.chineseTL: You want me to bring you some gifts when I come back to port? Commander must first perform the port duties well first~
8.japanese: 今度土産を持ってきてほしいって？貴方、母港で仕事をちゃんとこなしておくのが先じゃなくて？
8.japaneseTL: You want me to bring a souvenir back next time? You must first perform your port duties properly then, don't you think?
8.english: You want me to bring you back a souvenir next time? Should you really be asking that while you still have work to do?

9.chinese: 哦？迫不及待地就想看我训练？那就好好给你展示一下~
9.chineseTL: Oh? You can't wait to watch me train? Then I shall perform for you~
9.japanese: あら？私が訓練している姿が見たいの？では…その目に焼き付けてあげようかしら
9.japaneseTL: Ara? You want to see how I look like during training? Then... let me etch it into your eyes
9.english: Hm? You'd like to see me while I'm training? Very well... you'd better burn this into your eyes!

10.chinese: 不放开的话，你会知道下场的~
10.chineseTL: If you don't let go, you won't meet a good end~
10.japanese: その手、離さないと痛い目に遭うわよ
10.japaneseTL: That hand, if you don't let go it will hurt
10.english: If you don't unhand me this instant, I'll make you regret it~

11.chinese: 有任务就赶快处理，不要放置不管。说你呢，指挥官~
11.chineseTL: If there is a mission hurry up and handle it, don't leave it unattended. I'm talking about you, Commander~
11.japanese: 任務はほったらかすんじゃなくて、すぐに実行するのよ。――貴方のことを言ってるのよ？指揮官
11.japaneseTL: Don't leave missions unattended, if there is one complete it right away. I'm talking about you? Commander
11.english: If there are any missions left, take care of them right away. Don't procrastinate... Hey, I'm talking to you, Commander!

12.chinese: 抽空去看看吧，这是你应得的奖励。
12.chineseTL: Take some time to take a look, these are your deserved rewards.
12.japanese: 貴方が得るべき褒美よ。あとでチェックしなさい
12.japaneseTL: You deserve these rewards. Make sure to check them later.
12.english: You've earned these rewards. Take a look when you have time.

13.chinese: 快去收邮件吧~应该有好事发生。
13.chineseTL: Hurry up and get the mail~ Something nice must have happened.
13.japanese: メールを受け取ってちょうだい。いいことがあるわよ
13.japaneseTL: Hurry up and get the mail. There must be something nice
13.english: Please go get the mail. I expect some good news.

14.chinese: 嘻嘻，还是干得不赖嘛~可别太得意，后面还会有很多考验。
14.chineseTL: Ohoh, you managed to do well~ But don't get too ahead of yourself, there will be more ordeals following.
14.japanese: ふふん、よくできたじゃない。これからはもっと試される時があるの。あまり浮かれるんじゃないわ
14.japaneseTL: Fufun, you managed to do well. There will be more ordeals coming later. Better not get too ahead of yourself
14.english: Hehe, not bad. But don't get too cocky. There are still many trials ahead of us.

15.chinese: 委托组已经回来了。抽空审阅下他们的工作实绩吧。
15.chineseTL: Commission fleet has returned. Take some time to review their work performance.
15.japanese: 委託組、戻ってきたわよ。実績のほうをあとでチェックしなさいな
15.japaneseTL: Commission fleet has come back. Go review their performance later
15.english: The commission fleet has returned. Don't forget to check the performance records later.

16.chinese: 这下就能更好地护航了~
16.chineseTL: I'll be able to escort better~
16.japanese: 護衛任務、より確実にこなせるようになったのかしら？
16.japaneseTL: Escort mission, perhaps if I'll be able to handle it more reliably?
16.english: I wonder if I'll be even better at my escort duties now?

17.chinese: 上吧！大家都要发挥出最好的水准！
17.chineseTL: Let's go! Everyone exert your best!
17.japanese: 行くわよ！最高のパフォーマンスを出すわ！
17.japaneseTL: Let's go! Show off your best performance!
17.english: Let's go! I want to see everyone at their best!

18.chinese: 哼~看到了吧！这是只属于我的荣耀时刻~
18.chineseTL: Hmm~You saw that, right! That was the glorious moment that belonged only to me~
18.japanese: ふーん、目に焼き付けたのかしら？私だけの輝かしい瞬間を
18.japaneseTL: Fu~n, did you etch that into your eyes? The glorious moment belonging only to me
18.english: Hmph! Did you witness that? That's the glory that only I can bring to bear~

19.chineseTL: I actually failed... what a real mess.
19.japaneseTL: I managed to lose... how unsightly
19.english: To think that I would lose... how unsightly!

20.japanese: 護衛は私に任せてちょうだい！
20.english: Leave the escort duties to me!

21.chineseTL: I won't let me guard down!
21.japanese: 油断してはいけないわ！
21.japaneseTL: I won't let my guard down!
21.english: We can't afford to be careless!

22.chinese: 哼，被我无视，是你咎由自取！
22.chineseTL: Hmph, to be ignored by me, you brought that to yourself!
22.japanese: ふん、私に無視されるのも自業自得ではなくて？
22.japaneseTL: Hmph, to be ignored by me was brought upon yourself?
22.english: Hmph. If it's about me ignoring you, you brought this upon yourself!

23.chinese: 接下来我会处理一些文书并审核一些训练计划，指挥官最好也帮忙看下其中的细节，可别拖了我后腿哟~
23.chineseTL: I will be handling some documents and reviewing training plans next. Commander should also be helping checking the details, don't be slowing me down~
23.japanese: 次は書類作業と訓練プランの審査を行うの。指揮官もちゃんとチェックしなさい。私のペースを遅らせるんじゃないわ
23.japaneseTL: Let's handle some paperwork and review training plans next. Commander better check thoroughly. Better not be slowing me down
23.english: Next, I'll handle the paperwork and review the training plans. Commander, make sure to check my work properly. Don't slow me down, got it?

24.chinese: 被我迷住也是没办法的事。行吧，就允许你多发一下呆~
24.chineseTL: It can't be helped that you were charmed by me. Fine, I'll let you stare a bit more~
24.japanese: この私に魅されるのも仕方のないことよ。いいわ。もう少しそこでボーっとすることを許してあげる
24.japaneseTL: It can't be helped that you were charmed by me. Fine, I'll let you zone out for a bit more
24.english: Who can blame you for being so captivated by me? Very well, I'll allow you to gawk a bit longer.

25.chinese: 挨得这么近，是想感受一下我发梢的气味吗？嘻嘻，怎么样，有没有海风的味道？
25.chineseTL: Leaning so close to me, do you want to feel the smell of my hair? Ohoh, how is it, can you taste the sea breeze?
25.japanese: こんなに近くまで寄って、もしかして私の髪の匂いが気になるのではなくて？うふふ、どう？海風の香りでもあるのかしら？
25.japaneseTL: Getting this close to me, could it be that you want to feel the smell of my hair? Ufufu, how is it? Can you taste the scent of sea breeze?
25.english: Sidling up to me this closely... Are you trying to smell my hair? Hehe, how is it? Does it remind you of the sea breeze?

26.chinese: 缺了我总觉得浑身不自在？放心吧，我会为你尽心护航的，所以，你也要尽心陪着我才好~
26.chineseTL: You don't feel right without me? Don't worry, I'll do my best to be your escort, so you must also keep me company as far as you can~
26.japanese: 私がいないと違和感を感じるって？安心して、私がいつも貴方の護衛についているから。むしろ貴方も、私のそばにずっといなさいな
26.japaneseTL: Nothing feels right without me? Don't worry, I'll always be your escort. And you too, stay by my side forever
26.english: You feel uneasy when I'm not around? Don't worry, I'll always be here to escort you. As a matter of fact, you should make sure to always be around me.

27.chinese: 感到光荣吧，你已经得到我孟菲斯的认可了~我现在对你可是充满期待哟，可不要让我失望了~
27.chineseTL: Feel honored, you managed to get acknowledged by me, Memphis~ I am now full of hopes for you, don't disappoint me~
27.japanese: 光栄に思いなさい。貴方は私、メンフィスに認められたのよ――これからも期待しているから、失望させないでちょうだい
27.japaneseTL: Feel honored. You are acknowledged by me, Memphis~ From now on I am full of hopes for you, so don't let me down
27.english: Do you feel honored? You've managed to earn my recognition. From here on out, I'll have high expectations for you, so don't let me down~

28.chinese: 好不容易能一起出战。跟我前进吧~
28.chineseTL: For once we're out on sortie together. Follow me~
28.japanese: せっかく一緒に出撃するんだから、私のペースに付いてきなさいな
28.japaneseTL: For once we're out on sortie together, keep up with me
28.english: At long last, we're finally able to fight together. Follow my lead!

29.chinese: 节日快乐，指挥官。这可是新鲜现做的巧克力呢，要第一时间把它吃掉哦！
29.chineseTL: Happy holidays, Commander. This is freshly made chocolate, you must eat it at once!
29.japaneseTL: Happy Valentines, Commander. You're getting this chocolate made by me as present, hurry up and eat it. Fufufu

2.label: カジュアルバケーション

1.chinese: 嗯？这身打扮很稀奇吗？我也是有休息日的哦？不觉得像这样悠闲地吹着海风很舒服么～？哼哼～
1.chineseTL: Hmm? You find this dress up unusual? I have days off too, you know? Don't you feel it's really comfortable to leisurely enjoy the sea breeze like this~? Hehe~
1.japanese: あら、この格好はそんなに珍しいかしら？私だって非番の日にはあるのよ？ふふん、こうしてのんびりと海風を浴びるのも気持ちいいと思わない？
1.japaneseTL: Ara, you find this appearance unusual? I also have off-duty days too, you know? Fufun, don't you think it feels nice to leisurely enjoying the sea breeze like this?

2.chinese: 嗯？这身打扮很稀奇吗？我也是有休息日的哦？不觉得像这样悠闲地吹着海风很舒服么～？哼哼～
2.chineseTL: Hmm? You find this dress up unusual? I have days off too, you know? Don't you feel it's really comfortable to leisurely enjoy the sea breeze like this~? Hehe~
2.japanese: あら、この格好はそんなに珍しいかしら？私だって非番の日はあるのよ？ふふん、こうしてのんびりと海風を浴びるのも気持ちいいと思わない？
2.japaneseTL: Ara, you find this appearance unusual? I also have off-duty days too, you know? Fufun, don't you think it feels nice to leisurely enjoying the sea breeze like this?

3.chinese: 早安，今天的风也很棒，是适合乘船旅行的日子呢，你不觉得吗？
3.chineseTL: Good morning, today's wind is great, a suitable day for a boat trip, don't you think?
3.japanese: おはよう。今日もいい風。船旅にはもってこい、というべきかしら？
3.japaneseTL: Good morning. Today's wind is nice too. Should I say it's perfect for a boat trip?

4.chinese: 呼…今天就稍微放松一下吧…你也是，该休息的时候好好休息，才能在需要努力的时候更好的努力哦？
4.chineseTL: Phew... Let's relax a bit today... You too, you should take a good rest when you need to, so you can work hard when it's needed?
4.japanese: ふぅ…今日は気楽に過ごそうかしら……貴方も、努力すべきときは努力して、休める時は休むべきではなくて？
4.japaneseTL: Phew... Let's relax for today... You too, you should work hard when it's needed and take a good rest when you need to?

5.chinese: 拍照技术？虽说比不上真正的专业人士，不过好歹也是有不少经验的，可不会让你随便小瞧的哦？
5.chineseTL: Camera skill? Although I can't match up to a pro, but I still have plenty of experience myself, I won't let you look down at me?
5.japanese: カメラの腕？プロ顔負けとまで行かなくても経験者、侮らせはしないわよ？
5.japaneseTL: Camera skill? Although I can't match up to a pro, I'm still experienced, don't look down on me, ok?

6.chinese: 和布鲁克林偶尔会一起出门，不过和我不一样，她就算休息的时候也不大会放松……不，应该说她放松的方式和我完全不一样…吧……
6.chineseTL: I go out together with Brooklyn from time to time, but she's not like me. Even though it's a day off she can't relax at all... No, I should say her way to relax is completely different from mine...
6.japanese: ブルックリンとはたまに一緒に出かける仲よ。彼女は私と違って休みのときでもなかなかリラックスしないわ。…ううん、リラックスの仕方がぜんぜん違う、とでも言うべきかしら……
6.japaneseTL: I got out together with Brooklyn from time to time. She's different from me, even though it's a day off she can't relax at all... Hmmm, I should say her way to replax is completely different from mine...

7.chinese: 训练？你是不知休息日是什么意思吗？
7.chineseTL: Training? Don't you understand the meaning of a day off?
7.japanese: 訓練？貴方、休日の意味をわかっていないのかしら？
7.japaneseTL: Training? You, you don't understand the meaning of a day off?

8.chineseTL: Ah!? Y-you, what are you doing!?

9.chinese: （咔嚓）这边风景真不错！啊，指挥官你回来了啊？照片？哼哼，一会再给你看吧
9.chineseTL: *Snap* The view there is pretty good! Ah, Commander you came back? Photo? Hehe, I'll let you see later
9.japanese: （パシャッ！）これはいい眺めね！あら、指揮官、戻ってきたの？写真？ふふん、あとで見せてあげるわ
9.japaneseTL: *Snap!* This is a good view! Ara, Commander, you came back? Photo? Fufun, I'll let you see later

1.chinese: 就算是狂欢，也要拿出干劲，全力以赴才行呢~指挥官，准备好了吗？愉快的万圣之夜现在才要开始呢~
1.japanese: お祭り騒ぎは全力でやってこそよ？指揮官、準備はいいかしら？全力でハロウィンを楽しんでいくわよ？
1.english: We have to work hard if we want to play hard, isn't that right, Commander? Are you ready for our happy Halloween?

2.chinese: 就算是狂欢，也要拿出干劲，全力以赴才行呢~指挥官，准备好了吗？愉快的万圣之夜现在才要开始呢~
2.japanese: お祭り騒ぎは全力でやってこそよ？指揮官、準備はいいかしら？全力でハロウィンを楽しんでいくわよ？
2.english: We have to work hard if we want to play hard, isn't that right, Commander? Are you ready for our happy Halloween?

3.chinese: 指挥官来得正好~一起来做个南瓜灯吧？可要按照我的最高标准来做~
3.japanese: 指揮官、ちょうどいいところに。カボチャランプを作るの、手伝ってくれない？ふふ、作るからには私のペースで行くわよ？
3.english: Commander, you came at just the right time~! Shall we go carve the jack-o'-lanterns together? Just make sure you keep up with my high standards!

4.chinese: 指挥官要来颗糖果吗？我从阿贝克隆比那里拿来的~（瞄）
4.japanese: 指揮官、お菓子でもいかがかしら？アバークロンビーちゃんからもらってきたの
4.english: Commander, are you here to trick-or-treat? Here, I got this candy from Abercrombie.

5.chinese: 给来访的孩子们发糖果的任务就交给你了，指挥官~…我？嘻嘻，当然是想办法再要点糖果回来~
5.japanese: 指揮官、お菓子配りを任せるわよ。私？ふふ、もちろんお菓子をもうちょっと調達してくるわ
5.english: I'll let you handle giving candy out to the trick-or-treaters, Commander~ Me? Hehe, of course I'm going to go bring back more candy~

6.chinese: 现在的我可是魔女哦，不好好表现的话，就把你变成幽灵~嘻嘻，开玩笑的
6.japanese: ええ、魔女として素行の悪い指揮官をお化けにしちゃおうかしら？ふふ、冗談よ
6.english: I'm a witch now, so if you're not on your best behavior, I'll turn you into a critter~ Hehe, just kidding!

7.chinese: 扫帚和魔女可是标准搭配，不接受反驳哦
7.japanese: 魔法とホウキこそ定番――反論なんて許さないわよ？
7.english: Look, a witch and her broomstick are always paired together. I won't hear your objections!

8.chinese: 指挥官也想和我一起坐扫帚吗？真拿你没办法…掉下去我可不管哦？
8.japanese: 指揮官もこのホウキに乗りたいのかしら？しょうがないわね…落ちても知らないわよ？
8.english: Commander, you'd like to sit on the broom with me? I suppose you can... but it's not my problem if you fall off, okay?

9.chinese: …还是把你从扫帚上踢下去算了！
9.english: ... I should just boot you off the broomstick and be done with it!

10.chinese: 大家都在用各自的方式享受着万圣节呢，嗯嗯~很好很好~
10.japanese: みんなハロウィンを楽しんでるわね。ふふ、良かったわ
10.english: Everyone has a different way of enjoying Halloween. Hehe, that's how it should be~

11.chinese: 让你们尝尝魔女的厉害~
11.japanese: 魔女の力を思い知りなさい！
11.english: Have a taste of a witch's power!
